title: Oak Forest
question_text:
The proportion of red oak trees on the west-facing slope of a $200$ acre forest is known to be $p_w=0.82$. The east-facing slope has known proportion of $p_e=0.73$. The numbers of trees per acre in this densely packed forest is $550$. A research team tags a random sample of $56$ trees from the west-facing slope and an additional random sample of $40$ trees from the east-facing slope.
What is the probability that the difference between the proportion of red oaks in the west and east samples, $\hat{p}_w-\hat{p}_e$, is more than $25\%$?

choices.text: The answer cannot be computed because the population distribution of the difference between the proportion of west and east facing slope red oaks is unknown.
